title: infinite recursion does not crash on release (only gives a warning)
body:
Infinite recursion that panics on debug mode only gives a warning in release mode.

```rust
fn f(x: i32) -> i32 {
    f(x)
}

fn main() {
    println!("{}", f(0));
}
```

I expected to see this:

```warning: function cannot return without recursing
 --> src/main.rs:1:1
  |
1 | fn f(x: i32) -> i32 {
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ cannot return without recursing
2 |     f(x)
  |     ---- recursive call site
  |
  = note: `#[warn(unconditional_recursion)]` on by default
  = help: a `loop` may express intention better if this is on purpose

warning: 1 warning emitted

    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 1.97s
     Running `target/debug/playground`

thread 'main' has overflowed its stack
fatal runtime error: stack overflow
timeout: the monitored command dumped core
```

Instead, i saw this:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
warning: function cannot return without recursing
 --> src/main.rs:1:1
  |
1 | fn f(x: i32) -> i32 {
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ cannot return without recursing
2 |     f(x)
  |     ---- recursive call site
  |
  = note: `#[warn(unconditional_recursion)]` on by default
  = help: a `loop` may express intention better if this is on purpose

warning: 1 warning emitted

    Finished release [optimized] target(s) in 0.56s
     Running `target/release/playground`
                            Standard Output
0
```

### Meta
Tested on stable `1.48.0` and  nightly `1.50.0`
